item.title: Locations
item.description: Locations of a timed automaton are graphically represented as circles. If a timed automaton is considered as a directed graph, then locations represent the vertices of this graph. Locations are connected by edges. Names Locations can have an optional name. Besides serving as an identifier allowing you to refer to the location from the requirement specification language, named locations are useful when documenting the model. The name must be a valid identifier and location names share the name space with variables, types, templates, etc.

item.title: Edges
item.description: Locations are connected by edges. Edges are annotated with selections, guards, synchronisations and updates. Edges may also have branches of possible destinations with their own updates and probabilistic weights. Selections Selections non-deterministically bind a given identifier to a value in a given range. The other three labels of an edge are within the scope of this binding. Guards An edge is enabled in a state if and only if the guard evaluates to true.
